In [[Colorado]] it might be covered by the [[misdemeanor]] "treats the body or remains of any person in a way that would outrage normal family sensibilities" (Colorado Statutes/Title 18 Criminal Code/Article 13 Miscellaneous Offenses/18-13-101. Abuse Of A Corpse).
In [[Colorado]] it might be covered by the [[misdemeanor]] "treats the body or remains of any person in a way that would outrage normal family sensibilities" (Colorado Statutes/Title 18 Criminal Code/Article 13 Miscellaneous Offenses/18-13-101. Abuse Of A Corpse).

Similarly in [[Alabama]], where it was considered that sexual acts with a body may constitute “abuse of a corpse”, but not rape. [http://www.ca11.uscourts.gov/opinions/ops/19966752.OP.pdf]

Similarly in [[Alabama]], where it was considered that sexual acts with a body may constitute "abuse of a corpse", but not rape. [http://www.ca11.uscourts.gov/opinions/ops/19966752.OP.pdf]
In the [[United Kingdom]], necrophilia was banned outright with the new [[Sexual Offences Act 2003]].
In the [[United Kingdom]], necrophilia was banned outright with the new [[Sexual Offences Act 2003]].
